Bash(jj commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Add type specialization infrastructure and align type system docs

This commit introduces comprehensive type specialization infrastructure and
aligns the type system documentation with the language reference.

## Documentation Updates

- TYPE_SYSTEM_DESIGN.md: Aligned with SYNTAX_REVISION.md
  * Fixed type naming: Int/Float → Int32/Float64 for primitives
  * Fixed type naming: Int → Integer for abstract type
  * Updated all examples to use correct Character Calculus syntax
  * Updated date to 2026-01-08

- TYPE_SPECIALIZATION_DESIGN.md: New design document
  * Type specialization strategy and implementation plan
  * Speculation cache and JIT integration design

## Type System Infrastructure

- csrc/analysis/type_env.{c,h}: Type environment management
- csrc/analysis/type_infer.{c,h}: Type inference engine
- Updated csrc/analysis/analysis.c: Integration with new type system

## Specialization Codegen

- csrc/codegen/spec_codegen.{c,h}: Specialized code generation
- csrc/codegen/spec_db.{c,h}: Specialization database and cache
- csrc/codegen/spec_decision.{c,h}: Specialization decision logic
- csrc/codegen/typed_array_codegen.{c,h}: Typed array code generation
- Updated csrc/codegen/codegen.c: Integration with specialization

## Runtime Support

- runtime/src/typed_array.c: Typed array implementation
- runtime/include/typed_array.h: Typed array public API
- runtime/src/primitives_specialized.c: Specialized primitive operations

## Parser Updates

- Updated csrc/parser/parser.c: Support for new type syntax

## Testing

- tests/bench_specialization.omni: Specialization benchmarks
- Updated TODO.md: Track progress

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
Bash(__NEW_LINE__ echo "=== OmniLisp Integer Performance Tests ===")
